ovdesc.p: This application holds the pricing information for creating DX.MARKET.PRICE record

desc.p: Its value should be a valid record in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
The delivery period or prompt date of the contract transacted.
It is the contract currency provided in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER and any currency for FX-OTC options for which currency not defiend at contract level.
It is the contract currency provided in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER and any currency for FX-OTC options for which currency not defiend at contract level.
It holds two values either CALL or PUT based on the trade.
Its valid value from DX.PRICE.SET.
If the revaluation occurs during End of Exchange then PRICE.SET holds the value CLOSING.
If the revaluation occurs Online then PRICE.SET holds the value CURRENT.
The price at which an option holder has the right to buy (Call Options) or sell (Put Options) the underlying instrument, or to cash-settle the option if appropriate, to exercise the option.
Internal number of ticks * tick value for strike price.
This will hold the value either American, European or Carribean options
It holds Valid DX.OPTION.TYPE.
It holds valid DX.USR.FLD.OPT.
This is the user field value.
User field value from USR.FLD.VAL.
The currency of the quoted price in which valuation should be done.
If QUOTE.CCY is Null then it defaults to TRADE.CCY.
The new price in which revaluation should be done and is in QUOTE.CCY.
It is a NOINPUT field.
The rate of exchange between the price currency and the quote currency
It holds the quote currency price in which revaluation should be done and is in TRADE.CCY.
It is the calculated internal value of PRICE
This is the key to this DX.MARKET.PRICE record.
The record key comprises the following attributes:

price set * exotic type (if applicable) / contract /contract currency / maturity date / call or put (only for options) / strike price (only for options) / delivery currency / option style * exotic option data, delimited by '/' (for exotic options only).
